com.esri.mo2.map.img
Interface Image

All Superinterfaces:
Data, MapData, Spatial
All Known Subinterfaces:
ServerImage
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseServerImage
public interface Image
extends MapData

A simple geo-referenced image.

The image is assumed to be alligned with the coordinate system, that is, no rotation or shear involved in the transform.

setTransparency

public void setTransparency(double value)
Sets the transparency alpha value. This will be used to determine how transparent the image should be rendered. A value of 1.0 means completely opaque, and 0.0 means completely transparent. With this property the entire image can be set to become transparent, compared with Transparency color which only sets one particular color as transparent. The default is normally a value of 1.0, meaning completely opaque.

Parameters:
value - the transparency value
See Also:
getTransparency()

getTransparency

public double getTransparency()
Returns the current transparency value.

Returns:
the transparency value
See Also:
setTransparency(double)

setTransparentColor

public void setTransparentColor(Color color)
Sets the transparency color. This will be used to cause just one particular color to be transparent when the image is rendered, when compared with Transparency property which sets the entire image as transparent. You can set the color to be null which means there is no transparency color (this is the default).

Parameters:
color - the transparency color
See Also:
setTransparentColor(java.awt.Color)

getTransparentColor

public Color getTransparentColor()
Returns the current transparency color.

Returns:
the transparency color
See Also:
setTransparentColor(java.awt.Color)
